title: Coronation Street's 'grieving' Katie McGlynn says watching Sinead's death was like 'seeing loved one die'
text:

Coronation Street actress Katie McGlynn was in tears after watching character Sinead Tinker's death for the first time and compared it to "seeing a loved one die".

The actress, 26, filmed her final scenes last month as Sinead dies from cervical cancer.

She will make her exit from the show at the end of this month.

Speaking at today's screening of the harrowing episode, which sees Sinead say goodbye to her loved ones before dying in her bed with son Bertie and husband Daniel at her side, she admitted that she felt as though she were grieving for her character.

"It is sad because we've developed the character for six and a half years and I feel like I know her and she's gone now," the soap star revealed to Mirror Online. "So watching her final days - it doesn't feel like I'm watching myself, it feels like I'm watching her.

(Image: ITV)

"It's really sad, I feel like someone's died."

Asked whether filming the scenes had affected her personally, Katie admitted: "When you're filming, you can't switch off.

"You've got to be tapped into those emotions in order to get yourself there. So when I was there it felt like it was real, when you go home you can't really switch off."

She added: "I don't take life for granted as much, I guess.

"I've been a bit more emotional with my friends and family, as in more caring and loving. Because I've been told I'm a heartless cow sometimes!"

Sinead's heartbreaking death comes after the character was told her cancer treatment is no longer working following her recent diagnosis.

She learned after her wedding day to Daniel Osbourne that her cancer had returned, having discovered a lump on her neck, and she was told by a doctor her illness was now terminal.

(Image: SCU)

She was diagnosed with cervical cancer in 2018 but she learned earlier this month that it had returned, and spread to her lymph nodes and her liver.

With Sinead being given just months to live, she and Daniel struggled to cope - but next week there is more devastating news that leaves them in shock.

Sinead's harrowing death will air over two episodes as she lapses in and out of consciousness, forgiving husband Daniel for kissing Sinead and discussing her lost future.

*Sinead's final scenes air on Coronation Street for half an hour on Thursday 24 October and Friday 25 October for an hour
description: Soap star Katie McGlynn was left in tears at the screening of Sinead Tinker's death as she watched it for the first time
